citeinfo.title: Elementary, Secondary and Unified School Districts in Arizona
citeinfo.onlink: \\mainlib\data1\Teams\RSS\RSS Shared\AZ Geospatial Data Maps\Migration to UAiR\Exported Shapefiles\Schools\Schools.shp

descript.purpose: The data are created to serve as base information for use in GIS systems for a variety of planning and analysis purposes. Use of data for Engineering work is prohibited.
descript.abstract: These data sets consist of the School Districts in Arizona by county.

idinfo.accconst: Access is granted to public agencies. The Department makes no warranties related to the accuracy of the data and users are required to determine suitability of use for any particular purpose.
idinfo.useconst: Not for use at scales greater than 1:100000.

cntorgp.cntorg: Arizona State Land Department, Arizona Land Resources Information System

browse.browsed: Graphic demonstrates extent and features of data set

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

horizpa.horizpar: Approximate horizontal accuracy is 51 meters, assuming source data meets National Map Accuracy Standards

srcinfo.srccontr: This source was used to create intermediate ARC/INFO format data sets from which the data set was then created

procstep.procdesc: Processed the Census Bureau TIGER/Line for Arizona to create ARC/INFO coverage format intermediate fils by running the TIGERARC command
Ran ARC/INFO DISSOLVE command using item for school districts (sdall) in the .PAT file as the dissolve item to create a school district coverage for each county in Arizona

Ran ARC/INFO ADDITEM command to add items for school district codes for elememtary, middle, secondary and unified school districts as well as for for elememtary, middle, secondary and unified school district names. Ran INFO command to move data into these items.
Ran ARC/INFO PROJECT command to convert from decimal degrees to UTM zone 12 with a -3.2 million meter Northing offset, then ran ARC/INFO BUILD command to rebuild topology after the projection

Ran ARC/INFO LIBRARIAN INSERT command to insert each county into a state wide library data structure where the tile structure consisted of the county boundaries (see metadata for data set known as TIGCOUNTY)
Ran ARC/INFO LIBRARIAN EXTRACT command to extract and append the state wide set of school districts
Ran ARC/INFO PROJECT command to remove the -3.2 million meter Northing offset and convert the data to UTM zone 12, then ran ARC/INFO BUILD to reestablish topology after projection

attracc.attraccr: Accuracy of area and length attributes is unknown. A report has not been completed.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Elementary School District Code as identified through the US Department of Education, National Center for Education
Middle School District Code as identified through the US Department of Education, National Center for Education Statistics.
Secondary School District Code as identified through the US Department of Education, National Center for Education
Unified School District Code as identified through the US Department of Education, National Center for Education.
User assigned identification number for each polygon
Area of feature in internal units squared.

stdorder.fees: Public agencies can utilize the data for cost of media only and no charge for internet downloads. Commercial entities can obtain a cost waiver for contract work for public agencies. Fees will be assessed for purely commercial use of the data.
stdorder.ordering: Other formats are available. Please refer to Contact Person.

cntorgp.cntper: REQUIRED: The person responsible for the metadata information.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

metadata.title:
: Census FIPS Pub 55 code (MCD/CCD).
This data set consists of polygon data for the Census FIPS Pub 55 code (MCD/CCD) for the State of Arizona. FMCD's are legally defined subcounty areas such as towns and townships.
This is a Vector data set. It contains the following vector data types (SDTS terminology):
Complete chain (316) GT-polygon composed of chains (81) Area point (78)
Horizontal positions are specified in geographic coordinates, that is, latitude and longitude. Latitude and longitude values are specified in Decimal degrees.
dBase file (Source: None)
Arizona State Land Department, Arizona Land Resources Information System
The data are created to serve as base information for use in GIS systems for a variety of planning and analysis purposes. Use of data for Engineering work is prohibited. .
(source 1 of 1)
The data set was extracted from the Tiger/Line files by the FMCD code.
Date: 1994 (change 1 of 1)
This data set was created from the Tiger/Line files from the FMCD code.
Data sources used in this process:
TG92
Accuracy of area and length attributes is unknown. A report has not been completed.
Approximate horizontal accuracy is 51 meters, assuming source data meets National Map Accuracy Standards.
NONE
Data set is complete
Polygon and arc-node topology exists.
Access is granted to public agencies. The Department makes no warranties related to the accuracy of the data and users are required to determine suitability of use for any particular purpose.
Users must assume responsibility to determine the usability of this data for their purposes.
SHP (version 3.2) Size: 2.016
Other formats are available. Please refer to Contact Person.

Metadata author:
Metadata extensions used:
